channel.title: Masters Academy: Debating and Public Speaking Podcasts
channel.description: Masters Academy is proud to present the latest from the public speaking and debating world. Each episode includes tips, tricks and never before released information from experienced coaches and adjudicators.
channel.itunes:author: James Smith
channel.itunes:subtitle: Masters Academy: Debating and Public Speaking Podcasts
channel.itunes:summary: Masters Academy is proud to present the latest from the public speaking and debating world. Each episode includes tips, tricks and never before released information from experienced coaches and adjudicators.

item.title: Episode 1 - Public Speaking Overview
item.description: In this episode: What is Public Speaking, Interaction without interacting, Active listening, HOW to make your speech stand out, Manner, Hand Gestures, The best new resources.
item.itunes:author: James Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 1 - Public Speaking Overview
item.itunes:summary: In this episode: What is Public Speaking, Interaction without interacting, Active listening, How to make your speech stand out, Manner, Hand Gestures and the best new resources.
item.itunes:keywords: education, debating, public speaking, confidence, James Smith, manner, matter, speech

item.title: Episode 2 - Topic Selection
item.description: In this episode: Topic selection explained, Getting a 'good' topic and making a decision as a team.
item.itunes:author: James Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 2 - Topic Selection
item.itunes:summary: In this episode: Topic selection explained, getting a 'good' topic and making a decision as a team.
item.itunes:keywords: education, debating, public speaking, confidence, James Smith, topic, team, speech

item.title: Episode 3 - Rebuttal for Primary Schools
item.description: In this episode: Simple Structure of rebuttal for primary, How to rebut with purpose, What to attack first and secrets to make it easy!
item.itunes:author: James Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 3 - Rebuttal for Primary Schools
item.itunes:summary: In this episode: Simple Structure of rebuttal for primary, How to rebut with purpose, What to attack first and secrets to make it easy!
item.itunes:keywords: education, debating, public speaking, rebuttal, James Smith, rebut, attack, speech

item.title: Episode 4 - Identifying Types of Debates
item.description: In this episode: The four types of debates, making sure you know which is which, each type of debate explained and the basics on how to approach each type of debate.
item.itunes:author: James Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 4 - Identifying Types of Debates
item.itunes:summary: In this episode: The four types of debates, making sure you know which is which, each type of debate explained and the basics on how to approach each type of debate.
item.itunes:keywords: education, debating, public speaking, debate, James Smith, types of debate

item.title: Episode 5 - Policy Change Debates
item.description: In this episode: Identifying policy change, approaching the 'model', understanding the 'Status Quo' and addressing the real issues.
item.itunes:author: James Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 5 - Policy Change Debates
item.itunes:summary: In this episode: Identifying policy change, approaching the 'model', understanding the 'Status Quo' and addressing the real issues.
item.itunes:keywords: education, debating, public speaking, debate, James Smith, status quo,policy, policy change,issues

item.title: Episode 6 - Rebuttal For High School
item.description: In this episode: Difference between primary school and high school, what works in high school, how to 'up the ante', expansion of rebuttal and thematic rebuttal.
item.itunes:author: James Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 6 - Rebuttal For High School
item.itunes:summary: In this episode: Difference between primary school and high school, what works in high school, how to 'up the ante', expansion of rebuttal and thematic rebuttal.
item.itunes:keywords: education, debating, public speaking, debate, James Smith, status quo,policy, policy change,issues

item.title: Episode 7 - Beginner Coaching Tips
item.description: In this episode: The role of the coach in primary school, understanding the process, getting the method togetherg, how to get the most out of feedback, dealing with a 'bad beat' and the emotional angle.
item.itunes:author: James Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 7 - Beginner Coaching Tips
item.itunes:summary: In this episode: The role of the coach in primary school, understanding the process, getting the method togetherg, how to get the most out of feedback, dealing with a 'bad beat' and the emotional angle.
item.itunes:keywords: education, debating, public speaking, debate, James Smith, coaching,emotional,process

item.title: Episode 9 - Timing
item.description: In this episode: What is timing, why timing is important, argument prioritization, timing and rebuttal and adjudicator reaction.
item.itunes:author: James Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 9 - Timing
item.itunes:summary: In this episode: What is timing, why timing is important, argument prioritization, timing and rebuttal and adjudicator reaction.
item.itunes:keywords: education, debating, public speaking, debate, James Smith, argument,rebuttal,timing

item.title: Episode 10 - Tracking Debates
item.description: In this episode: An explanation of the concept of tracking and its uses, how to prove that you have been tracking a debate and a few tips for implementing tracking in a debatehat is timing.
item.itunes:author: James Smith
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 10 - Tracking Debates
item.itunes:summary: In this episode: An explanation of the concept of tracking and its uses, how to prove that you have been tracking a debate and a few tips for implementing tracking in a debatehat is timing.
